dt-button.name: deleteAllStates
dt-button.description:
This button can be displayed at the top level alongside the `-button savedStates` and `-button createStateRestore` buttons. This button deletes all `-init stateRestore` instances. This completely removes the states from storage, as well as removing the buttons that represent them.
No confirmation modal is shown as default when using this button.
This button is used within the `-init stateRestore` extension. It won't do anything if deleting states is disabled using the `-init stateRestore.delete` initialisation option.
dt-button.option: The action function for the `-button deleteState` button calls the `-api stateRestore.states().delete()` function to delete the state.

This function runs the `-api i18n()` function to decide the text value of the rename button. The value of this button can be set using the `-init i18n` initialisation options `buttons.deleteAllStates` property, or you could directly change the value of this function.
